intro: Phaenopyrum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy phaenopyrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Phaenopyrum hirsutum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
